item.title: Report X-2025041759
item.description:
Report X-2025041759

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-11
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO AND TRANSPORTED LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON OPENING THE LEAKING PACKAGE IT WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN 37 CANS OF AEROSOL SANITIZING SPRAY. THE PACKAGE WAS A REUSED AMAZON PACKAGE AND DID NOT HAVE A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND ON THE OUTER PART OF THE PACKAGING. THE PACKAGE LEAKED DUE TO THE CAP AND NOZZLES OF THE CANS BEING DAMAGED.

item.title: Report X-2025041914
item.description:
Report X-2025041914

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-28
  • City: OSHKOSH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CONTENTS OF ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE TRIGGER TERM OF IPHONES VISIBLE ON GREEN TAPE AFFIXED TO THE OUTER CASE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE IPHONES AND TWO POWER BANKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PELICAN CASE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM AN UNKNOWN CUSTOMER AND LOCATION IN WISCONSIN. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING THE CONSIGNEES ACCOUNT NUMBER 018821, ESPN, 545 MIDDLE ST, BRISTOL CT 06010-8413. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2025040559
item.description:
Report E-2025040559

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 23, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1908 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 30-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2025041198
item.description:
Report X-2025041198

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/15/2025 at approximately 1930, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3962863 at the station location in Madison, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one polystyrene box that contained dry ice. The shipment was discovered having the distinct rattling and being cold to touch. Further investigation revealed that package confirm the suspicions of dry ice. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. Due to delicate nature of the medication being shipped, the shipper was contacted the retrieved the shipment.
